alert.note: Alert for Rockland; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 5:22AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey and southeast New York, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, Bergen. In southeast New York, Rockland and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New City, Monsey, Nanuet, Suffern, Tappan, Pearl River, Orangeburg, Pomona, Upper Nyack, Spring Valley, River Vale, Valley Cottage, Park Ridge, Airmont, Congers, Upper Saddle River, Chestnut Ridge, Montvale, Hillcrest and New Square. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
